org.safs.persist

Class PersistorToHierarchialFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.persist.PersistableChecker
      • org.safs.persist.AbstractPersistor
        • org.safs.persist.AbstractRuntimeDataPersistor
          • org.safs.persist.PersistorToFile
            • org.safs.persist.PersistorToHierarchialFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Persistor
    Deprecated. 
    The most functionalities has been moved to class PersistorToHierarchialString, those functionalities will be decoupled from this class.
    Currently the class PersistorToHierarchialString has 2 sub-class PersistorToJSONString and PersistorToXMLString.
    The classes PersistorToJSONFile and PersistorToXMLFile will not extends from this class PersistorToHierarchialFile any more, they will directly extends the class PersistorToFile and delegate the 'parse job' (Persistable <--> String) to class and PersistorToJSONString and PersistorToXMLString.

    @Deprecated
public class PersistorToHierarchialFile
extends PersistorToFile
    Write the Persistable object to a persistence of hierarchical structure, such as JSON, XML file.
    Author:
    Lei Wang

      protected void write(Persistable persistable)
      Deprecated. 
      Write the Persistable object to a persistence of hierarchical structure, such as JSON, XML file.
      This is a template method, it is calling the method below: containerBegin(String) childBegin(String, String) childEnd(boolean) containerEnd(String)

    • Method Detail

      • write

        protected final void write(Persistable persistable)
                    throws SAFSException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Write the Persistable object to a persistence of hierarchical structure, such as JSON, XML file.
        This is a template method, it is calling the method below:
        1. containerBegin(String)
        2. childBegin(String, String)
        3. childEnd(boolean)
        4. containerEnd(String)
        Specified by:
        write in class PersistorToFile
        Parameters:
        persistable - Persistable, the object to persist
        Throws:
        SAFSException
        java.io.IOException

      • getTagName

        protected java.lang.String getTagName(java.lang.String className)
        Deprecated. 

      • containerBegin

        protected void containerBegin(java.lang.String className)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        This is called inside write(Persistable) to write the begin of a container such as:
        • <tagNam> for XML file
        • "tagName" : {\n for JSON file
        Parameters:
        className - String, the class name of a container. This is a full class-name, which may needs to treated to get the simple class name as the tag-name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • childBegin

        protected void childBegin(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.String value)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        This is called inside write(Persistable) to write "key" and "value" of a child.
        Parameters:
        key - String, the key name
        value - String, the value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • parseFiledValue

        protected java.lang.String parseFiledValue(java.lang.Object value)
        Deprecated. 
        Parse the parameter value and convert it to a string which will be persisted to (File or Variable or ...)
        The following are the ways to parse value:
        • The String value will be PersistorToFile.escape(String) and double-quoted if needed.
        • The array value will be transformed into [item1, item2, item3]
        • The Number value will be returned as string without quote.
        Parameters:
        value - Object, the filed's value
        Returns:
        String, the parsed result of the field's value
        null if the parameter 'value' is null.
        Throws:
        SAFSException

      • childEnd

        protected void childEnd(boolean lastChild)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        This is called inside write(Persistable) to write the end of a child, here a newline "\n" is written.
        Parameters:
        lastChild - boolean, if this is the last child within the container. it is useful for some file format, such as JSON, if this is false (not the last child), a comma , needs to be added at the end as "key" : "value" ,
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • containerEnd

        protected void containerEnd(java.lang.String className)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        This is called inside write(Persistable) to write the end of a container such as:
        • </tagNam> for XML file
        • } for JSON file.
        Parameters:
        className - String, the tag name, it is normally a container. This is a full class-name, which may needs to treated to get the simple class name as the tag-name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
